channel.title: What to expect
channel.description:
I just did a Qubes Whonix install, and wonder what I should expect. I show the Dom0 launcher but nothing else. Shouldn't there be a way to enter the VMs? Since I was in dom0, I didn't install KDE.
I can hit the "Show/Hide inactive VMs" button, and start the "work" VM, but how do I enter it? I can right click on the desktop, select "Applications, Domain: work, work: Firefox, but is that right? Is everything done from Dom0?
I hope there's a page of instructions I missed, because https://check.torproject.org/ comes back "Sorry. You are not using Tor." and shows my real IP.

item.title: What to expect
item.dc:creator: dooright
item.description:
Well, I DID follow the https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Qubes/Install install. But I didn’t want KDE garbaging up my Dom0, so I did the XFCE install instead.

This time I did the KDE install, and everything went as planned. I discovered that yes, you do work form Dom0 and open applications, rather than like in VirtualBox where you open VM machines.

It seems to be working now. Thanks.

Read full topic

item.title: What to expect
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Follow the instructions.

Whonix

Qubes/Install

How to install Qubes-Whonix.

For example, start the browser.
Qubes App Launcher (blue/grey “Q”) -> Domain: whonix -> Privacy Browser

’ “Show/Hide inactive VMs” button’ -> Unrelated.

“Domain work:” -> Not routed through Tor by default unless you configure it that way. Better don’t and use a Qubes-Whonix-Workstation.

Read full topic
